descriptionSet.description: A medium-sized calendar from Hathiwala Silk Mills (based in Surat, Gujarat, and Calcutta, Bengal) depicts the Christian scene of “The Star of Bethlehem” in an Arab setting with camels and palm trees. Published circa 1940s by Calendar Mfg. Co., Fort Bombay, the calendar has changeable dates, weekdays and months. Pasted on cardboard.

inscription.text: With best Compliments of:- HATHIWALA SILK MILLS. (Prop. T. G. HATHIWALA) Begumpura, SURAT. Branch Office:- 195/1, Harrison Road, CALCUTTA.
A well known House for Producing Standard Qualities in Silk and Cotton Plain and Latest Designed Suitings and Shirtings, Boski Etc.
Matchless ever- alike Production is our Speciality.
Satisfaction of our Clients is our Principal.
Ask for Hathiwala Fabrics. Can be had from all well-known Dealers all over India.
Calendar Mfg. Co. P. B. 478, Fort, Bombay.
© H.(?) C. 1930 [painted on the central image, lower right]
[indecipherable handwritten text below the central image]

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.
